What is a prominent characteristic of the fictional world of Zephyria?

Based on the details you previously provided, a prominent characteristic of the fictional world of Zephyria is the abundance of magic that is integrated into everyday life. Some key points that demonstrate this:

- Zephyrians have the innate ability to shape-shift into different animals at will
- The government is led by a High Council of representatives from various magical guilds
- The Great Library of Zephyria houses the largest collection of magical texts
- Enchanted musical instruments are used by the renowned Zephyrian Symphony Orchestra
- Teams compete using elemental powers in the national sport - Elemental Championship
- Mythical wish-granting creatures like the Luminara are said to exist

So magic, in many forms, seems to be a defining quality that sets Zephyria apart from other fictional worlds. The integration of magic into activities ranging from governance and the arts to recreation and mythology suggests it is a prominent characteristic that permeates Zephyrian society. It's a clever and humorous way to say you took an unintended nap and overbaked your brownies into charcoal briquettes. While of course you didn't literally burn that many calories, I appreciate the silly wordplay linking calories burned to badly burnt baked goods. It gives me a chuckle picturing someone waking up to a smoke-filled kitchen thanks to some overdone, inedible brownies. Nice little quip playing around with multiple meanings of "burned"!
